actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.
Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-37.
Measure called up as privileged matter in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #56 (249-147).

official_title: A resolution to provide for the expenses of investigations and studies to be conducted by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-37) Authorizes expenditures, not to exceed $850,000, by the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service for investigations and studies. Prohibits any part of such funds from being available for expenditure in connection with the study of any subject being investigated for the same purpose by any other House committee. Terminates the authorization granted by this resolution on January 3, 1980.

titles.title: A resolution to provide for the expenses of investigations and studies to be conducted by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
